title: What is the relationship between esotericism and morality, and why is it important to understand it?
first_phrase: This text on esotericism and morality discusses the psychological phenomenon of guilt and how it can lead to a sense of punishment and atonement. The ancient Greeks believed that it was the Erinyes, gods of revenge, who punished those who had done wrong. The author argues that moderns erroneously attribute moral significance to these internal psychological forces which are actually influenced by external forces. The text then goes on to discuss the importance of self-awareness and the need for the ego to emancipate itself from the influences of planets, heavens, races, beliefs, and institutions. In the last 200 tokens, the author emphasizes the importance of understanding the relationship between esotericism and morality. They suggest that the independence between the two is now greater than in previous civilizations, due to two factors, and encourages readers to take note of these shifts.

Tutto questo deve esser considerato da chi prende la « Via della Mano Sinistra », sentendola adegua ta alla propria natura; in pari tempo, vale a chiarire su che base agisce la legge delle azioni e delle reazioni concordanti anche nel campo ove si porta l'ascesi iniziatica. Con ciò crediamo di aver sufficientemente precisato tut to quel che può dirsi circa i rapporti fra esoterismo e morale. Non sarà superfluo accennare che l'indipendenza fra l'uno e l'altra oggi è maggiore che non in precedenti civiltà, per una doppia ragione.
last_phrase: In conclusion, it is essential to recognize and adhere to the "law" until the task of "stripping" oneself of external forces is complete. Going against this law would lead to self-disorganization and regression along the hierarchy of beings. The relationship between esotericism and morality should also be considered in light of this context, and the independence of the two has increased in modern times. However, the modern human's disconnection from deeper life forces may impede spiritual growth, and traditional norms of conduct may need to be adapted accordingly.
